My apologies if this has been answered already.

I installed the RTM add-on for VS2012 and created a new MVC4 project. If I add a TS file to the project it doesn't build it automatically when I build the project. The compiler for the file is set correctly as well. Am I missing something?

FYI all the intellisense works for the file and it all seems to work perfectly in VS2013 with Update2.

Thanks,
Eric
To be clear, you mean the TS file as its BuildAction set to TypeScriptCompile in the VS Properties pane? Does the project file import the Typescript .targets file?
Yes that is correct about the BuildAction. I did not do anything to import a .targets file. Do I have to do that manually?
I got it working by adding the imports to the project file. Thanks.
